name: (LD50) It's Cold, I Am Dead
description:
inspired by this video of a cat who really wants to eat a dead fish but it’s trapped under the ice It's Cold, I Am Dead You’re a fish that’s died, but you’re not ready to get eaten by hungry cats yet! Plug up the melting ice with anything you can find to stop a hungry cat from eating you!

A simple one-button physics game about using your momentum, rotation, etc. to whack junk into melting ice to plug it up! The ice is melting, though, so it's only a matter of time before there's no ice left to plug up if you don't maintain it enough! Once the ice melts, there's nothing to stop the hungry cat from catching you, and then it's game over!

Features:
  • One button (click on desktop or tap on mobile)
  • Fun physics go ping pong
  • Sfx go ding
  • Beginner baby's unknowledgeable attempt at sprite stacking
  • Cool music (a bit crunchy on mobile the first pass through, because Godot web builds :/ )
  • Probably colorblind friendly? I didn't check yet, but I used the same palettes I always do, except for the gradient background
Information:
  • Fish: This is you. Click/tap where you want to go, and the fish will spin towards that spot!
  • Kelp: Pretty bad at patching the hole, doesn't do much for your score either, but it's the easiest thing to whack!
  • Boot: Also pretty bad for score, but patches the ice pretty decently!
  • Grail: The Holy Grail! Or, well, one of many floating around in your pond.  It's the best for your score, but patches worse than kelp.
  • Gold: Pretty good for score, but only patches as well as kelp.
  •   Anchor: These heavy sunsa guns are the best for patching up the ice! Not shabby for your score, either, although not as nice as the Grail.
Tools:
  • Engine: Godot 3.4.4
  • Music: Beepbox.co
  • Sfx: Audacity & hitting a random cup on my desk with a pen
  • Art: Paint.net
